column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I was imagining "deep-dish" would be thick
column2: doughy crust with a bit of toppings
column3: but I couldn't have been more wrong.  The crust
column5: was a decent (not too thick) thickness and super crispy that easily held up to the toppings - not chewy or doughy at all.  There was a good amount of cheese and topping
column6: but I would have been pleased eating just the crispy
column7: buttery crust (and I am a die-heard thin crust pizza lover).  A small pizza was more than enough to fill up the Hubs and I
column8: and it was definitely worth the wait.
